column5: Wondering where I can buy one of these for cheap or if you guys know any place that rents these out so that I don't have to buy one.  I need one to cut exhaust pipe from a car at the scrap yard.  Would like to go prepared in case there is not enough clearance to use a hacksaw.   Thanks
None of your friends have a cordless 4 1/2" grinder and a cut off disc?
Cordless chop saw is what i use but if you want a.chainncutter carquest or napa can supplie them aroind $40
I usually just break the bolts off.

This what you're looking for?  http://www.stephensons.ca/index.php/2011/05/24/pipe-cutter-6-soil-ratchet/ That will snap the exhaust manifold, but crush the exhaust pipe. A sawzall (battery powered) will cut through the bolts attaching the exhaust system to the manifold easily.
That pipe cutter won't work on a metal exhaust. They're made to cut cast iron pipe.

Cast iron cutter will not work. There is a similar looking device for cutting exhaust pipes but much smaller called a chain wheel cutter. I use a  18 volt grinder with a keef or cut off  blade to cut metal pipes and bolts when the plasma cutter is not around.   Art
